column4: okay i opened the repository list all i see is "CD Ubuntu 5.04 Hoary (Binary)"
the learning curve for linux is steep compared to windows
you could of course buy up all the companies that own the mp3 stuff and force them to release it for free or you could say to hell with that and get with the progam - ogg or some such

stand back from that comment for a minute. My wife has her first computer - she has been using that other stuff for years - I installed ubuntu for her and she loves it so much that she is thinking that maybe her fathers first pc should have it too, and he only has like 4 weeks of class room experiance
can you assist me with my sources.list file - it was sent to me last night via email and i know it works i just cant recall where to put it
if you look in /etc/apt/ you might find what you want :)

no ask in the channel if I think that I have an answer then we _may_ take it to message if and only if think it would bore the socks off everyone and then if I do not have the answer then others moight
we may have given you some advice alright :)
I know what you are trying to achieve, however I have not done same, just one question is that partition mounted?
yes - its auto mounted every bootup - i put it in my fstab file
and you can cd to it?
so start with the bits you use :-)
what about you what o you think?
